I found the desk space area to have plenty of room for my laptop and takeout food and I really liked the room set up. Granted the rooms are on the smaller side, but this is excellent value for your money and the room was very comfortable. Let’s face it, it is New York city folks! The city is your playground and your room should be someplace sleep, shower and well you know the rest. Club quarters provides a nice respite, good location, security, and great value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Sleek new hotel adjacent to WTC”
Reviews.Author: lwwylam
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights at the Club Quarters WTC with a colleague in a twin-bedded room which faced away from the construction site. Although it was possible to hear some slight noise from the street and from the hallway, it was not enough to be disturbing. The Club Quarters concept is an attractive one for business travelers. The Club Living Room at this location, with a fireplace, large screen tv and multiple computer work stations along with comfortable chairs, was a welcoming place to take advantage of the free internet and printing access. The room was reasonably spacious by NYC standards, immaculately clean and comfortable, with contemporary design and convenient amenities. The Guest Request closet, which makes it possible to help oneself to extra pillows, blankets, or coffee supplies, is an especially nice touch, as are the chilled bottled water dispensers on each floor. The bar/restaurant on the 20th floor is quite nice, with excellent food and drinks. The view of the WTC construction site from the 20th floor terrace is stark and powerful.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: carallangennech
Reviews.Content: Great for visiting Ellis Island/Statue of Liberty and ground zero but not close to shopping or theatres so awkward to go back to rest before evening out. Subway 5 min walk though and very safe to use but chaotic 8.45-9.30 am and 4.45-5.30pm. On our only visit, Restaurant staff rude. desk staff very helpful and friendly and knowledgeable if you smile and say hello! Our room overlooked the memorial construction site but the noise was only bad when you opened the window. No taxi driver knew where the hotel was, shame, as they were very reasonably priced. Town car to the East village $25. Room was very comfortable

Reviews.Title: “Great value for NYC but off the beaten path”
Reviews.Author: Mnree7
Reviews.Content: Good value, but off the beaten track I stayed at the Club Quarters at the Trade Center for 3 nights and I would recommend it because of the value. I am originally from NYC and was back for a visit-- it is in an area that is hard to get to and always a cab or subway away from where you probably want to be. Also, it is VERY hard to find as it is on a dead end street that borders the World Trade center. It is close to Wall Street and Battery Park though, and pretty much deserted at night. Once the Freedom Tower is built, I am assuming the price of the hotel rooms here will shoot up, and there is a rooftop restaurant that looks into the WTC site. It was creepy to see people drinking martinis and eating dinner while viewing that, but once the construction is done that will change. The hotel itself is new and nice,although you can tell it was once an office building turned hotel, as the hallways are narrow and the rooms are tiny. I originally had a room where the window opened up onto another person’s balcony which I found that strange, but they immediately gave me the keys to another room. Overall, if you are looking to save money and don’t mind staying in a remote area or taking public transport everywhere, this is a modern and clean hotel

Reviews.Title: “A World Trade Center Experience I’ll never forget!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mrali52
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a non exit street, so you have to walk like three minutes to get to the street... Overall the hotel is very clean and I was really satisfied. The price was a little high.... Great service and fast checkout. Has a lot of restaurants just blocks away and even the subway station is close. I loved the decoratipn and the view of the terrace is priceless... It was worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - bad staff”
Reviews.Author: LAwindsor
Reviews.Content: I went with my other half for a 5 day break. The hotel is good, clean and safe. The staff however where a great let down. They where rude, moody and just not very helpfull at all. I am quite light sleeper and found the noise from the building site very hard to deal with. It goes on all night, even thought he staff promised it would stop at 10. The airconditioning is also rather loud. All in all, no help from staff when this was mentioned.We where offered a downgrade, as we where in a suite, to a standard room on the other side of the building, but no refund or any other help. After picking up some earplugs from a local shop, the sleep was better. There is water on every floor with bottles which is quite handy, but make sure you take a bottle when you see one as we only saw them on the first day and never where filled up untill we left. There is also a guest cupboard on every floor with extra pillows, blankets coffee etc. Same goes for this, when you see something you need grab it as they dont fill this up either. The restaurant staff seemed more interested in chatting with each other than helping and became rude when the tip was inadequate. I didnt feel the need to tip seeing as i had to order and pick up my drink from the bar myself! The view is spectacular as it is overlooking the ground zero site. As more people have said its a bit of a mixed feeling sitting on the rooftop with a cocktail overlooking this. There are quite a few metro stations around, and its very close to the staten island ferry, wall street and battery park. I think this hotel caters more for the business guest, than leisure and would therefore suggest you stay more uptown to get the best service. When taking a yellow cab, tell them its the old Club quarter hotel, just around the corner from the Mariott downtown. Otherwise it will be hard for the cabbie to find the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Similar to other club quarters”
Reviews.Author: Meagen_S
Reviews.Content: Decent rate for New York. Was able to book in for 5 nights with less than 24 hours notice due to another hotel reservation cancellation caused by a bed bug infestation. Reception staff dealt well with confusing requests from my extended family despite it not being a full service hotel. Construction noise could be bothersome but why go to New York and spend your day in a hotel room? Construction noise stopped during evenings and nights. I would have preferred to stay in Midtown simply because of location but being able to stay here was a relief as I could depend on a level of quality without having to do further research.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Business Hotel for World Trade Centre”
Reviews.Author: MattTripper
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 nights at the Club Quarters WTC for business and when i first walked into my room i thought wow this is small. However the room had everything i needed with free wi-fi which was essential for me. As others have said before the work going on around the hotel did start early in the morning but i was already up for work & enjoying the fantastic view from the breakfast terrace. I would recommend this hotel if in WTC area for business but on any leisure trip i'd book a hotel in midtown for a better location to explore

Reviews.Title: “new hotel, very clean modern rooms, needs security for women travelers.”
Reviews.Author: tobad
Reviews.Content: I liked the hotel over all even with the noise from ground zero rebuild. Actually found that nice to see after all these years but could be disturbing to some people. Hotel staff OK but not really into it's clientel. Some nice amenities like the botled water station. Not much ssecurity for women travelers as no one at front desk some times and easy access to stairs. Common ..maybe you could install a security access at the entrance like the one in the elevator. ..using your room key maybe? Otherwise clean, great rroftop reasonable dinning and the best value in NY this year.

Reviews.Title: “Very well located and spacious for New York”
Reviews.Author: Mixbag65
Reviews.Content: A fair price; a nice, clean and spacious room with everything we needed. The A/C unit was a little old and rickety, noisy, but it worked. Also, the wall insulation seemed somewhat thin, as we could hear everything going on in the hallway at a very early hour. The location is superb if you wish to be in the financial district.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel at Decent Price (for NYC Standards)”
Reviews.Author: PatrickCA15
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel over the Labour Day weekend. Definitely would not be my first choice, but was able to get a good price ---especially for Labour Day weekend--- so I couldn't pass up the deal! The location is not great as it is just south of the World Trade Centre, and there is construction going on right now to rebuild the World Trade Centre. It is a bit far from everything, but due to the availability of taxis and the extensive subway network, it was not too bad to get around. The hotel itself is only 2-3 years old, so everything is fairly new & in working order. There is complimentary wi-fi throughout the hotel, so that helps! There is also a filtered water dispenser on each floor. The rooms are quite small ---which is to be expected, as it is NYC. But not much to complain here as we were only in the hotel to sleep in. There is no parking at the hotel, but there is valet parking on the side street (Albany St), which is somewhat costly ($45 USD for a 24-hour period). Overall, I don't recommend it at this time because of the location & the construction for the World Trade Centre. The construction is scheduled for completion in 2013, so may be it will be better then. But of course, the prices will probably be higher as well.

Reviews.Title: “NOT worth the money”
Reviews.Author: brookssus
Reviews.Content: In the 5 nights we were there our bathroom floor was NOT scrubbed ONCE, the shampoo and soap was NOT replaced (thankfully we had brought our own). There was water bottles and filtered water but by 1100hrs each morning the water bottles had not been replaced so we were forced to have to buy water. No parking, no off load zone. Parking around the corner was $175.00 for 5 days. Even though I had talked to the hotel a couple of times to verify logistics they never ONCE informed me of a $40.00 PER DAY charge for incidentals. So on top of $900.00 for the hotel plus $175.00 for parking they then wanted in excess of $200.00 for incidentals. I say NO WAY--enough was enough. There was no continental breakfast included....everything you needed or wanted you had to pay for. There was a "fitness centre" and both treadmills did not work leaving just a creaky eliptical and an exercise bike. It should never have advertised it as a fitness centre.

Reviews.Title: “Great value. Noise will prevent a good sleep.”
Reviews.Author: soloToronto
Reviews.Content: If you don't mind the noise this is a great bargain hotel. The rates will jump dramatically when the construction and deconstruction is done. The construction speaks for itself. This will be ongoing for another 5 years but in the immediate future it's the deconstruction that created the most noise. As per my photographs the 40-story tower adjacent to the hotel that was badly damaged by the events of Sept. 11, 2001is being cleaned and deconstructed systematically from the top down. Dumping concrete and twisted girders in dumpsters all day long is deafening. The deconstruction efforts started every day, besides Sunday, at 07:30 AM. Don't plan on sleeping in. I did have trouble checking in. I pre-paid a Suite. I questioned why my reservation had me reserved in a Studio. The person at check in told me to disregard the term Studio? When I entered the Suite it was indeed a Studio? I called down to explain my dilemma. I was told they would try to get me a better room. I didn't want them to do me any favors, I just wanted them to give me what I pre-paid for. Anyway, to make a long story short I got my Suite but not without some "discussion", for lack of better words. In summary the hotel as it sits today is in a construction zone and the rates reflect that. If you don't mind the noise it's a diamond in the rough.

Reviews.Title: “Meh”
Reviews.Author: ItinerantLondoner
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a business trip because the usual accommodation was full. CQ seems to have cornered the market in doing the bare minimum in acceptability to ensure corporate bookings. Everything can be endured - but there is nothing that makes your stay pleasant. - Water pressure was like showering under a tap - All the lighting in the room was halogen/fluorescent - a bit like trying to relax in a sunbed. - The restaurant/bar was more like an extra-large bedroom and lacked any kind of atmosphere or ambience that would have made it pleasurable - but this didn't stop them enforcing a dress code. - If you're travelling on business (especially alone), a half-decent room service or restaurant/bar makes like a lot easier, especially on the night you arrive. I ended up at the marriott next door. - TV only half-worked in the channels you could get. If you're not planning to spend any time in your room other than to sleep this is probably not a bad option. It is clean and efficient but gives nothing more (assuming the location works). If you're a business traveller who values a decent shower and somewhere to retire to for a couple of hours - possibly also to work - it's not great.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here...”
Reviews.Author: Shep48
Reviews.Content: This hotel has to be one of the worst hotels I've stayed in ever if only because it is perched adjacent to the rebuild site of Ground Zero. This wonderful show of determination in the face of greatest adversity and tragedy has the unfortunate knock on effect of causing sleepless nights - this is night 2 of a planned 3 night stay and I have already booked another hotel Midtown to escape the frustration and upset of not being able to get a night sleep due to the constant construction work. This is Friday night into Saturday morning and the construction continues... The rooms are small, clean and the hotel tries with guest laundry facilities and plentiful water to all as well as internet facilities. But the staff are not very present, and it's such bad value at any price if it's a nigh sleep you're after. I'd never recommend it and I'll take the hit on having to pay for the 3rd night without actually staying...

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: ray1green
Reviews.Content: Stayed here only because the Downtown Club Quarters gave my room away. Yes, when I checked in they said my room with 2 twins was being cleaned. After lunch I came back and was told I had a new room with 1 queen. Once I explained this was not ok and a pretty long argument they put me in a cab and took me to the WTC Club Quarters. What an upgrade. Brand new room, great location and free breakfast. I believe that will only last until the outdoor area is open. The place is ready and is really nice. For the money you cant beat it. Clean, modern and easy to check in/out. Next time I would just book WTC and avoid Wall Street.

Reviews.Title: “Quality hotel, even with construction”
Reviews.Author: donkey31
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because we're from the midwest on midwest salaries ;) So paying an NYC rate for a room is murder to the wallet! But we managed to stay for $199 a night for 3 nights and thought we got a lot for our money - a clean room, clean bathroom, nice closet, free WiFi, free breakfast (even though it was probably only for a short time since they're under construction and they didn't even have tables!), etc. What I didn't particularly like was the fact that our room was facing out down a small hallway with a direct line to the elevator. Since the walls are pretty thin and / or the acoustics in the hall are a little scant, we would be woken up by people congregating in the hall waiting for the elevator. Anywhere else this wouldn't be a problem, but if I were to stay here again, I'd request to NOT be by the elevator. That really is the only complaint I have about the place. Even the construction and lack of breakfast tables didn't bother me! You might be far away from things in Midtown, but the subway is only about a block away off Rector. We had no problem taking the subway uptown to hit all of our touristy stops. We really did nothing downtown but walk around the WTC area. I recommend taking this hotel up on its low rates right now, because it's a high quality facility and rates will probably sky rocket once everything's done!

Reviews.Title: “Good for a short stay in NYC”
Reviews.Author: so3003
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at Club Quarters WTC for a few nights at the end of April, at the start of a holiday in the US. It's in a prime location right over the site of the planned Freedom Tower / 9-11 memorial in Downtown Manhattan. We booked a studio suite through Hotelclub, but when we checked in the first room we were given was a standard room, so they moved us to a studio room. To be honest, there was very little difference between the two room types, and if anything their website is a bit misleading when it infers the studios are much bigger rooms - have a look at my photos to see what I mean. Despite the above our room was fine, definitely spacious enough for two people, and in addition to the Queen bed there was a separate desk, microwave, fridge, flatscreen TV etc. The bathroom was a decent size, though the toilet-roll holder fell off the wall on the first day! Decor, furnishings etc were very clean and modern. As others have mentioned the hotel is still under construction, though really you're only aware of this if you 1) see the signs about this in the lobby or 2) meet the workmen in the hallways. We bumped into some one morning and it turned out the room next to us was being "installed / built", but we really weren't disturbed at all by the work. The construction work means there's no hotel restaurant, so the hotel provides a free buffet breakfast in one of their meeting rooms - very good selection of muffins, cereal, fruit juice, coffee etc, and the inclusion of breakfast was what made this a super good deal in New York. They didn't do room service, but instead offered a delivery service from local takeaways to your room. The club "living room" area of the hotel is very well appointed, and is a significant positive for this hotel. There are computers with colour printing, and a dedicated "boarding pass" computer/printer every morning to get your lastminute documents before heading for the airport. In terms of hotel location it's right in the heart of downtown, only a couple of minutes walk from Battery Park (and ferry to Statue of Liberty), not too far from the Subway, and being next to the WTC site makes it a good landmark for taxis, airport buses etc to aim at. I'd go back to this hotel, though next time I'd probably just book a standard room.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fantastic rooms, odd breakfast set-up”
Reviews.Author: Conomo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night and loved the downtown location & rooms. They have floor-ceiling windows, wonderful new amenities, very tech saavy and environmentally conscious. This hotel will probably sky-rocket in price once the construction ends. The only odd thing was breakfast - it was a fantastic, fresh continental selection, but there were no tables for eating. The hotel provided boxes to "takeaway" your meal. So, we toasted our bagel, scooped fresh fruit, poured good coffee and juice and then, returned to our room to dine. The hotel is still without a restaurant. Also, the parking deal $25/day with a local garage is fantastic for NYC. I recommend and will go back without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay with very good amenities”
Reviews.Author: Trav3l1er
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights while I attended a conference downtown. The location worked very well for me as the conference was right by the New York Stock Exchange, and was a mere 5 minute walk away. While the hotel is under construction, they are offering a nice continenta; breakfast spread. There is also a managers reception/happy hour in the evenings offering beer wine and cheese. The value of the room at just over $200 was good for the area and I was very happy with the room. I got a corner room on the 15th floor which had a flat screen tv at the foot of the bed with cables to hook up a laptop or other video source via component cables. There was another tv at the end of the small workspace which could be viewed from the table or from the easy chair which could convert to single bed. There was also the added benefit of both a microwave and small fridge. There are filtered water machines in the halls with water bottles that you can fill up for your day of sightseeing. The fitness room was adequate with 3 treadmilIs, free weights, an adjustable bench, eliptical and 2 other machines? The first floor has a number of workstations which you can use to check email, surf the web, and they even have a color printer you can print to. I was a little disappointed that they hit me with a $35 early check in fee, but oh well.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel after bad 1st experience”
Reviews.Author: aussietraveller1960
Reviews.Content: On checking in found that despite booking studio room was provided with a standard room. As hotel was full and we were returning we were offerred an upgrade on our return which was honoured but was not a great 1st experience. Being relatively new the rooms are in excellent condition. The space in the studio was awesome. As currently no restaurant a free breakfast is provided. This has great variety. Hotel has good access to the subway. Being in Lower Manhattan there is not a large range of dining options. Location is very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: himpantsou
Reviews.Content: I have just got back from staying 3 nights at Club Quarters. I arrived at 12pm and left my bags as check in was not until 3pm. When I came back to check in after dinner, I pleasantly found my bags had already been taken up to my room. I booked a standard room and was given a superior corner room on the 17th floor with amazing views of the Brooklyn Bridge, downtown Manhattan and the river from 3 corners. It really was breathtaking. The quality of furnishings was very high with thick cotton bedsheets, thick blackout curtains and nice towels. There is also unlimited bottled water in the hallway. There was no noise at all from outside, I had a view of the World Trade Center and could not hear the construction work going on. Service was excellent. The concierge were very happy to book tickets for you for theatre, Empire State etc and they charge a $2.50 admin fee or you can book yourself on the free computers they provide in reception. The printers really came in handy as I was able to print out maps for my walk abouts. The only downside I found was breakfast and the reason why I have marked it down by 1 star. It really was chaotic. Breakfast is served in a side room near reception and there are no tables so you have to eat from polystyrene plates off your lap. There is also not a lot of choice. They had cereal, muffins and bagels. The rest of the hotel made up for the poor breakfast. Sunday - Thursday they have beers, soft drinks, cheese & salami 5-7pm which was nice to come back for a small rest before dinner. Overall, this hotel was fantastic and I would happily stay at any Club Quarters again.
